intro: Senecio antipodus, commonly known as the Antipodean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a head, which are borne on slender stems. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Senecio antipodus is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads.
